Reservoir Dogs.title: Reservoir Dogs
Reservoir Dogs.synopsis: After a simple jewelery heist goes terribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.
funfacts: This movie contains the most number of "f*cking" in any Tarantino movie (180 times).
The movie was shot in 35 days.

Pulp Fiction.title: Pulp Fiction
Pulp Fiction.synopsis: In the realm of underworld, a series of incidents intertwines the lives of two Los Angeles mobsters, a gangster's wife, a boxer and two small-time criminals.
funfacts: The briefcase's combination is 666, the number of the beast, a reference to the soul of Marsellus Wallace.
This is Quaratino's most profanity filled movie!
The film was shot in chronological order, so the actors could get a feel for how their characters developed.

Jackie Brown.title: Jackie Brown
Jackie Brown.synopsis: A flight attendant caught smuggling gun money has to choose between teaming up with the cops to bust her arms dealer boss or concealing the information and going to jail.
funfacts: The film is based on the novel Rum Punch by Elmore Leonard. The novel's title was changed to "Jackie Brown" for the film, as Tarantino felt it was a more appropriate title for a blaxploitation film.
The film was originally intended to be set in Los Angeles, but to save money, the setting was changed to Tarantino's hometown of Torrance, California.

Kill Bill: Vol. 1.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
Kill Bill: Vol. 1.synopsis: The Bride awakens from a four-year coma. The child she carried in her womb is gone. Now she must wreak vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her - a team she was once part of.
funfacts: The Bride's name is bleeped out every time it is mentioned, except for once, when Bill says her name in the chapel.
The Bride's yellow outfit is a tribute to Bruce Lee's yellow tracksuit in Game of Death (1978).

Kill Bill: Vol. 2.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
Kill Bill: Vol. 2.synopsis: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.
funfacts: Kill Bill was originally supposed to be one film
Tarantino was basically at the end of the writing process when he realized he could still have the daughter alive as a twist.
The second volume made even more money than the first!

Inglorious Basterds.title: Inglorious Basterds
Inglorious Basterds.synopsis: A few Jewish soldiers are on an undercover mission to bring down the Nazi government and put an end to the war. Meanwhile, a woman wants to avenge the death of her family from a German officer.
funfacts: Only 30% of the Film is Spoken in English
The movie had its scrip being written for almost a decade, before the making of Kill Bill began.
The film nearly wasn't made, as Tarantino was so frustrated with the script that he wanted to publish it as a novel instead.

Django Unchained.title: Django Unchained
Django Unchained.synopsis: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.
funfacts: The film was shot in chronological order, so the actors could get a feel for how their characters developed.
It originally supposed to be a sequel to Django (1966).
The film was shot in 130 days.
